hoooooooo-leeeeeeee crap XD

RCS ports are probably best to be done all through texturing with clever diff and nrm alignment, then, later go in and assign RCS ports over those spots in (unity I think, this is where my modding knowledge stops XD)

http://www.fxguide.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/12/IMG_4348_LARGE.jpg?62f061

So if anybody has money and connections to Christopher Nolan try to get BenJee access to this XD

OOH! OOOOOOOOOH! Proof there's a docking port on the bottom of the ranger. I think I know where it goes too. On the model from the Board the Endurance, there's a little hatch on the bottom, I'd assume that slide over and reveals a port.

@ Anyone who knows blender: Is there a way to make the model intersect two planes, and form vertices and edges where two faces cross? I've been trying to pretty up that model, to see if it can be used at all, but most of the pieces are open meshes just kind of smushed together, in that faces intersect, and there's no connection between the two.

Are there any mods that have a Saturn V in it? It would be really cool if we could package the launch rocket in with the ranger.

EDIT: Durr. Of course there is: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/1636-Saturn-V-Parts-Pack-(v1-1)-(NEW-Fixed-PNG-s) or this one: http://www.curse.com/ksp-mods/kerbal/220632-fasa

Edited December 30, 2014 by Shryq

I love this thread. So many threads are cursed with people complaining and people derailing the topic (fyi not what I am trying to do lol). This thread is all about figuring out problems, people diving into books and pages of Google image searches to find the best reference images. Besides the fact that is being done on the models is incredible. Bravo! Keep it up and I can't wait to see the end product! Cheers and Happy New Year!

Hello guys.

Instead of another pityful attempt to recreate this ship ingame, where the thing destroy itself as soon as you touch the engines. I'm recreating a working endurance with stock parts, and the result is quite nice so far.

Maybe u know by now that I love space probes, so instead of doing a full fledged endurance, I'm doing it in a reduced scale.

After several trials I decided for a combination of ions + RCS. o10's in particular is a true problem solver. I know in the movie main engines are in the ring, and auxiliar ones are in the landers, but in this build, ions are in the ring, and more than a DOZEN of o10 are in the central section, wich is nice because the main weights and stuff are in the dead center, and the ring tends to wobble a lot if you push from the ring.

16 o2 RCs (6 each lander and 2 each ranger), is even more thrust of a RT10 Booster in vacuum, which is pretty ridiculous for a 15 dry-tons ship (5more t. on fuel). The total count will be around 300 pieces or something less.

Alpha testing have show that this thing is so far totally capable of reach anything in the kerbal system and deploy stuff everywhere around. Landers and rangers can dock from the surface of at least any minor body. Oh, the ship isn't specially fast btw...

Landers by now are nothing but a sketch, and a pretty much the rangers need a decent overhaul, but its coming quite nice.

pd. sorry about the off-topic

Edited January 4, 2015 by Iron4venger

This is coming together good!
